content:
TITLE: Attaching File to PDF using pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to attach a file to a PDF document using pikepdf's AttachedFileSpec class. Opens a PDF, creates a file specification from a filepath, and adds it to the PDF's attachments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/attachments.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pikepdf import Pdf, AttachedFileSpec, Name, Dictionary, Array

from pathlib import Path

pdf = Pdf.open('../tests/resources/fourpages.pdf')

filespec = AttachedFileSpec.from_filepath(pdf, Path('../README.md'))

pdf.attachments['README.md'] = filespec

pdf.attachments
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Encrypting PDFs with Permissions
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to save a PDF with encryption and custom permissions using pikepdf's Encryption and Permissions classes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/tutorial.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
no_extracting = pikepdf.Permissions(extract=False)

pdf.save('encrypted.pdf', encryption=pikepdf.Encryption(
     user="user password", owner="owner password", allow=no_extracting
))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Replacing PDF Images with Grayscale Version
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to replace an existing PDF image with a modified grayscale version. Includes resizing the image and updating the image properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/images.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> import zlib

>>> rawimage = pdfimage.obj

>>> pillowimage = pdfimage.as_pil_image()

>>> grayscale = pillowimage.convert('L')

>>> grayscale = grayscale.resize((32, 32))

>>> rawimage.write(zlib.compress(grayscale.tobytes()), filter=Name("/FlateDecode"))

>>> rawimage.ColorSpace = Name("/DeviceGray")

>>> rawimage.Width, rawimage.Height = 32, 32
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic PDF Merge Operation
DESCRIPTION: Simple implementation to merge multiple PDF files into a single document by combining all pages in order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/pages.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from glob import glob

pdf = Pdf.new()

for file in glob('*.pdf'):
    src = Pdf.open(file)
    pdf.pages.extend(src.pages)

pdf.save('merged.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic PDF Manipulation with Pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic usage of pikepdf to open a PDF file, get the number of pages, delete the last page, and save the modified file. Shows the elegant, Pythonic API of the library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# Elegant, Pythonic API
with pikepdf.open('input.pdf') as pdf:
    num_pages = len(pdf.pages)
    del pdf.pages[-1]
    pdf.save('output.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Basic PDF Outlines with pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add basic outline entries to a PDF document that reference specific pages. Uses the OutlineItem class to create bookmarks pointing to the 1st, 3rd and 9th pages of the document.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/outlines.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from pikepdf import Pdf, OutlineItem

>>> pdf = Pdf.open('document.pdf')

>>> with pdf.open_outline() as outline:
...     outline.root.extend([
...         # Page counts are zero-based
...         OutlineItem('Section One', 0),
...         OutlineItem('Section Two', 2),
...         OutlineItem('Section Three', 8)
...     ])

>>> pdf.save('document_with_outline.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing PDF Attachment Content
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to access and read the contents of an attached file in a PDF document using pikepdf's attachment API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/attachments.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
pdf.attachments['README.md']
file = pdf.attachments['README.md'].get_file()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rotating PDF Pages with pikepdf in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use pikepdf to open a PDF file, rotate all pages by 180 degrees, and save the modified PDF. It showcases the basic usage of pikepdf for page manipulation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/index.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# Rotate all pages in a file by 180 degrees
import pikepdf

with pikepdf.Pdf.open('test.pdf') as my_pdf:
    for page in my_pdf.pages:
        page.rotate(180, relative=True)
    my_pdf.save('test-rotated.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Page Thumbnail Overlay in Python using pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use pikepdf to add a thumbnail of the second page as an overlay on the first page of a PDF. It uses the Page.add_overlay method and specifies the position using a Rectangle object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/overlays.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from pikepdf import Pdf, Page, Rectangle

>>> pdf = Pdf.open(...)

>>> destination_page = Page(pdf.pages[0])

>>> thumbnail = Page(pdf.pages[1])

>>> destination_page.add_overlay(thumbnail, Rectangle(0, 0, 300, 300))

>>> pdf.save("page1_with_page2_thumbnail.pdf")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing PDF Name Trees with pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to open a PDF file, access its name tree structure for destinations, and retrieve keys and values. Shows how to work with the NameTree class to access destination objects and their properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/nametrees.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from pikepdf import Pdf, Page, NameTree

>>> pdf = Pdf.open('../tests/resources/outlines.pdf')

>>> nt = NameTree(pdf.Root.Names.Dests)

>>> print([k for k in nt.keys()])
['0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '7', '8']

>>> nt['2'][0].objgen, nt['2'][1], nt['2'][2]
((3, 0), pikepdf.Name("/XYZ"), Decimal('89.29'))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Opening and Saving PDFs with pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates basic PDF file opening and saving operations using pikepdf's Pdf class. Uses context manager for safe file handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/tutorial.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pikepdf import Pdf

with Pdf.open('sample.pdf') as pdf:
    pdf.save('output.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pretty-printing PDF Content Stream
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to parse and unparse a PDF content stream to pretty-print its contents in ASCII format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/content_streams.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
with pikepdf.open("../tests/resources/congress.pdf") as pdf:
    page = pdf.pages[0]
    instructions = pikepdf.parse_content_stream(page)
    data = pikepdf.unparse_content_stream(instructions)
    print(data.decode('ascii'))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing PDF Dictionaries
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access and inspect PDF document root dictionary structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/tutorial.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pikepdf import Pdf

example = Pdf.open('../tests/resources/congress.pdf')

example.Root  # Show the document's root dictionary
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Split PDF into Single Pages using pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to split a PDF into individual single-page PDFs. Creates new PDF files named with sequential numbers for each page in the source document.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/pages.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
pdf = Pdf.open('../tests/resources/fourpages.pdf')

for n, page in enumerate(pdf.pages):
    dst = Pdf.new()
    dst.pages.append(page)
    dst.save(f'{n:02d}.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting PDF Pages
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to remove specific pages from a PDF using slice notation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/_notebooks/pages.ipynb#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
del pdf.pages[1:3]  # Remove pages 2-3 labeled "second page" and "third page"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Editing PDF Content Stream Matrix
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to modify a content stream by updating the transformation matrix to center and resize an image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/content_streams.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
commands[1][0] = pikepdf.Array(new_matrix)
new_content_stream = pikepdf.unparse_content_stream(commands)
new_content_stream
page.Contents = pdf.make_stream(new_content_stream)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Combining Multiple PDFs
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to append and insert pages from other PDF files into the current document.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/_notebooks/pages.ipynb#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
appendix = Pdf.open('../../tests/resources/sandwich.pdf')
pdf.pages.extend(appendix.pages)
graph = Pdf.open('../../tests/resources/graph.pdf')
pdf.pages.insert(1, graph.pages[0])
pdf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting PDF Page Layout and Mode with pikepdf in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to open a PDF, set its PageLayout to SinglePage and PageMode to FullScreen, and save the modified PDF. It uses the pikepdf library to manipulate the PDF's Root object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/pagelayout.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pikepdf import Pdf, Dictionary, Name
with Pdf.open('input.pdf') as pdf:
    pdf.Root.PageLayout = Name.SinglePage
    pdf.Root.PageMode = Name.FullScreen
    pdf.save('output.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Nested PDF Outline Structure
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create hierarchical outline structures by adding child items to parent outline entries using the children list property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/outlines.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> with pdf.open_outline() as outline:
...     main_item = OutlineItem('Main', 0)
...     outline.root.append(main_item)
...     main_item.children.append(OutlineItem('A', 1))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting Images from PDF
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to extract images from a PDF to a file using PdfImage.extract_to() method. The file extension is automatically determined based on the image format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/images.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> pdfimage.extract_to(fileprefix='image')
'image.jpg'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: PDFDocEncoding Example in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the pdfdoc codec that pikepdf automatically registers with Python's standard library for encoding strings to PDFDocEncoding format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/encoding.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
"â€¢".encode('pdfdoc') == b'\x81'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting PDF Stream to Python File-like Object
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to convert a PDF page's Contents stream into a Python file-like object using BytesIO. This technique allows efficient access to stream contents using familiar file operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/streams.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
pdf.pages[0].Contents.page_contents_coalesce()
filelike_object = BytesIO(pdf.pages[0].Contents.get_stream_buffer())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Metadata with PikePDF in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to open and read XMP metadata from a PDF file using the PikePDF library in Python. The example opens a PDF and prints the 'xmp:CreatorTool' field from its metadata. Ensure PikePDF is installed and the file path is accessible.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/metadata.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
>>> pdf = pikepdf.open('../tests/resources/sandwich.pdf')

>>> meta = pdf.open_metadata()

>>> meta['xmp:CreatorTool']
'ocrmypdf 5.3.3 / Tesseract OCR-PDF 3.05.01'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Opening a PDF File with pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to open an existing PDF file using pikepdf's Pdf.open() method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/_notebooks/pages.ipynb#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pikepdf import Pdf

pdf = Pdf.open('../../tests/resources/fourpages.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing Images from PDF
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to effectively remove an image by replacing it with a 1x1 pixel transparent image mask. Updates the image resources in the PDF page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/images.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> pdf = pikepdf.open('../tests/resources/sandwich.pdf')

>>> page = pdf.pages[0]

>>> image_name, image = next(iter(page.images.items()))

>>> new_image = pdf.make_stream(b'\xff')

>>> new_image.Width, new_image.Height = 1, 1

>>> new_image.BitsPerComponent = 1

>>> new_image.ImageMask = True

>>> new_image.Decode = [0, 1]

>>> page.Resources.XObject[image_name] = new_image
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Editing Metadata in a With Block in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to use a 'with' block to edit metadata entries, such as changing the document title, in PikePDF. Changes are committed on block exit unless an exception occurs. Ensure the PDF is saved afterward.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/metadata.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
>>> with pdf.open_metadata() as meta:
...     meta['dc:title'] = "Let's change the title"
...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Detailed PDF Outline Destinations
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create outline entries with specific page positioning and fit options. Shows both direct creation and use of make_page_destination function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/outlines.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> oi = OutlineItem('First', 0, 'FitB', top=1000)
```

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> oi.destination = make_page_destination(pdf, 0, 'FitB', top=1000)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Reversing PDF Pages
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to reverse the order of pages in a PDF document in-place.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/_notebooks/pages.ipynb#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
pdf.pages.reverse()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating New Blank PDFs
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a new PDF document from scratch and add a blank page using pikepdf.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/tutorial.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pikepdf import Pdf

pdf = Pdf.new()
pdf.add_blank_page()
pdf.save('blank_page.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Reading Attachment Binary Content
DESCRIPTION: Example of reading the binary content of an attached file from a PDF document.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/attachments.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
file.read_bytes()[...]
b'**pikepdf** is a Python library for reading and writing PDF files.'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing PDF Images with pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to open a PDF file and access image objects using pikepdf. Shows how to retrieve image keys and create a PdfImage object for manipulation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/images.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from pikepdf import Pdf, PdfImage, Name

>>> example = Pdf.open('../tests/resources/congress.pdf')

>>> page1 = example.pages[0]

>>> list(page1.images.keys())
['/Im0']

>>> rawimage = page1.images['/Im0']  # The raw object/dictionary

>>> pdfimage = PdfImage(rawimage)

>>> type(pdfimage)
<class 'pikepdf.models.image.PdfImage'>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Updated Page API
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the improved page API in v3.0.0 where Pdf.pages returns Page objects directly instead of requiring manual wrapping.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/releasenotes/version3.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
# Old style
page = Page(pdf.pages[0])

# New style
page = pdf.pages[0]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Page Counting Numbers
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access pages using counting numbers (starting from 1) with the .p() accessor.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/_notebooks/pages.ipynb#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
pdf.pages.p(1)        # The first page in the document
pdf.pages[0]          # Also the first page in the document
;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Merging PDFs with Automatic Outline Generation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to merge multiple PDF files while automatically creating outline entries for each source file. Tracks page count to maintain correct page references in the outline structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/outlines.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from glob import glob

>>> pdf = Pdf.new()

>>> page_count = 0

>>> with pdf.open_outline() as outline:
...     for file in glob('*.pdf'):
...         src = Pdf.open(file)
...         oi = OutlineItem(file, page_count)
...         outline.root.append(oi)
...         page_count += len(src.pages)
...         pdf.pages.extend(src.pages)

>>> pdf.save('merged.pdf')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing PDF Pages with pikepdf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to open a PDF file with pikepdf and access its first page. The example shows the structure of a Page object, which contains content streams, media box dimensions, resources, and other properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/page.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
>>> from pikepdf import Pdf, Page

>>> example = Pdf.open('../tests/resources/congress.pdf')

>>> page1 = example.pages[0]

>>> page1
<pikepdf.Page({
  "/Contents": pikepdf.Stream(owner=<...>, data=b'q\n200.0000 0 0 304.0'..., {
    "/Length": 50
  }),
  "/MediaBox": [ 0, 0, 200, 304 ],
  "/Parent": <reference to /Pages>,
  "/Resources": {
    "/XObject": {
      "/Im0": pikepdf.Stream(owner=<...>, data=<...>, {
        "/BitsPerComponent": 8,
        "/ColorSpace": "/DeviceRGB",
        "/Filter": [ "/DCTDecode" ],
        "/Height": 1520,
        "/Length": 192956,
        "/Subtype": "/Image",
        "/Type": "/XObject",
        "/Width": 1000
      })
    }
  },
  "/Type": "/Page"
})>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating Object Lifetime Issue in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates a breaking change in pikepdf 7.0.0 where dependent objects no longer keep their parent alive. The function creates a PDF object and returns it, but attempting to read from the object after the function returns will now raise a DeletedObjectError.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/releasenotes/version7.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def make_obj_and_return():
    pdf = pikepdf.new()
    obj = pdf.make_stream(b'some data')
    return obj

...
obj = make_obj_and_return()
obj.read_bytes()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating PDF Attachment Annotation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create an interactive attachment annotation with a pushpin icon that allows users to view the attached document when clicked.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/attachments.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
pdf = Pdf.open('../tests/resources/fourpages.pdf')

filespec = AttachedFileSpec.from_filepath(pdf, Path('../README.md'))

pushpin = Dictionary(
    Type=Name.Annot,
    Subtype=Name.FileAttachment,
    Name=Name.GraphPushPin,
    FS=filespec.obj,
    Rect=[2*72, 9*72, 3*72, 10*72],
)

pdf.pages[0].Annots = pdf.make_indirect(Array([
    pushpin
]))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running QPDF Jobs
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to execute QPDF commands through pikepdf's Job interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/tutorial.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from pikepdf import Job

Job(['pikepdf', '--check', '../tests/resources/fourpages.pdf'])
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating In-Memory PDF Attachment
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create and attach an in-memory file to a PDF document with a specified MIME type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/attachments.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
memfilespec = AttachedFileSpec(pdf, b'Some text', mime_type='text/plain')

pdf.attachments['plain.txt'] = memfilespec
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PikePDF with Pip
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides the command to install the pikepdf package using pip. It's suitable for users on Linux, macOS, or Windows with x64 systems. To install the package for the current user, use the "--user" flag. No specific prerequisites are required apart from having pip installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install pikepdf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using New Attachment API
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the new attachment API introduced in v3.0.0 for managing PDF attachments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/releasenotes/version3.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
# New attachment API usage
pdf.open("document.pdf")
# Add/remove attachments using new API
pdf.save()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Opening PDF with Allow Overwriting in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to open a PDF file with pikepdf while allowing overwriting of the input file. This loads the entire PDF into memory for safety.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/releasenotes/version1.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
pikepdf.open(...allow_overwriting_input=True)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking PDF for Problems in Python
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the pikepdf.Pdf.check() method to check for problems in a PDF and get a text description of any issues found.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/releasenotes/version1.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
problems = pdf.check()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Appending and Extending pikepdf Arrays in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of .append() and .extend() methods on pikepdf.Array objects, which now behave similarly to Python lists.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/releasenotes/version1.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
pikepdf_array.append(new_item)
pikepdf_array.extend(new_items)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Advanced PDF Merge with Version Handling
DESCRIPTION: Enhanced PDF merge implementation that handles PDF versions and removes unreferenced resources for better optimization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/pages.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from glob import glob

pdf = Pdf.new()

version = pdf.pdf_version

for file in glob('*.pdf'):
    src = Pdf.open(file)
    version = max(version, src.pdf_version)
    pdf.pages.extend(src.pages)

pdf.remove_unreferenced_resources()

pdf.save('merged.pdf', min_version=version)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Pikepdf via pip
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to install the pikepdf library using pip package manager from PyPI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install pikepdf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Parsing PDF Content Stream Commands
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to parse a PDF content stream and extract its operators and operands, including matrix transformation information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/topics/content_streams.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
with pikepdf.open("../tests/resources/congress.pdf") as pdf:
    page = pdf.pages[0]
    commands = []
    for operands, operator in pikepdf.parse_content_stream(page):
        print(f"Operands {operands}, operator {operator}")
        if operator == pikepdf.Operator('cm'):
            matrix = pikepdf.Matrix(operands)
        commands.append([operands, operator])
```

TITLE: Building pikepdf and qpdf from Source with Virtual Environment Setup - Bash
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a full build workflow on Unix-like systems to compile qpdf from source and build pikepdf against it, using a dedicated Python virtual environment for isolation. The snippet involves building qpdf with CMake, capturing its library build path, and then activating a Python environment before running an editable install of pikepdf using paths to the freshly built qpdf. Users must have Python 3, CMake, and typical build tools installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/source_build.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Build libqpdf from source
cd $QPDF_SOURCE_TREE
cmake -S . -B build -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON
cmake --build build --parallel --target libqpdf
QPDF_BUILD_LIBDIR=$PWD/build/libqpdf

# Create a fresh virtual environment
cd $PIKEPDF_SOURCE_TREE
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate

# Build pikepdf from source
env QPDF_SOURCE_TREE=$QPDF_SOURCE_TREE QPDF_BUILD_LIBDIR=$QPDF_BUILD_LIBDIR \
    pip install -e .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Profiling pikepdf with py-spy and speedscope
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install py-spy and speedscope, then use them to profile pikepdf performance. This approach can profile both Python and C++ code execution times with symbol name demangling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/references/debugging.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# From a virtual environment with pikepdf installed...

# Install
pip install py-spy
npm install -g speedscope  # may need sudo to install this

# Run profile on a script that executes some pikepdf code we want to profile
py-spy record --native --format speedscope -o profile.speedscope -- python some_script.py

# View results (this will open a browser window)
speedscope profile.speedscope
```

TITLE: Building qpdf and Setting Up pikepdf Environment on Windows - PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Shows a multi-step process for building qpdf with CMake and preparing the pikepdf environment in Windows. Highlights setting environment variables for include and library directories, copying the freshly built DLL for Python's dynamic loader, creating a virtual environment, and installing pikepdf in editable mode. Requires administrative permissions, Visual Studio C++, and CMake installed in the environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/source_build.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
cd $qpdf
cmake -S . -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

cd $pikepdf
$env:INCLUDE = "$qpdf\include"
$env:LIB = "$qpdf\build\libqpdf\Release\"
cp $LIB\libqpdfXX.dll src\pikepdf  # Help Python loader find libqpdf.dll
python -m venv .venv
.venv\scripts\activate
pip install -e .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Python String Style Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the project's string quotation convention where user-facing strings use double quotes and internal strings use single quotes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/references/contributing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
"user facing string"  # For strings shown to users
'internal_string'    # For internal usage
```

TITLE: Changing QPDF Library Path in pikepdf Binary Extension on macOS
DESCRIPTION: Command to permanently modify the pikepdf extension module to use a custom QPDF library on macOS using install_name_tool, eliminating the need to set DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/references/debugging.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
install_name_tool -change /usr/local/lib/libqpdf*.dylib \
    $QPDF_BUILD_LIBDIR/libqpdf*.dylib \
    src/pikepdf/_core.cpython*.so
```

TITLE: Downloading and Extracting qpdf External Libraries - PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: Automates the process of downloading precompiled external binary dependencies required by qpdf and preparing them for use on Windows. The script uses PowerShell commands to fetch a ZIP archive for a given release version and expands its contents to the current directory. Requires PowerShell and network access to download binaries from GitHub.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/source_build.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
wget https://github.com/qpdf/external-libs/releases/download/release-$version/qpdf-external-libs-bin.zip -Outfile libs.zip
expand-archive -path libs.zip -destinationpath .
```

Assumes the user has a functioning Python environment and make utility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/source_build.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_5

```
cd docs

```

TITLE: Configuring Visual Studio Environment for pikepdf Compilation - Batch
DESCRIPTION: Prepares a Windows command prompt environment for building pikepdf with Visual Studio 2015, ensuring the correct compiler version is used. The script sets up environment variables required by distutils and initiates the compiler environment via vcvarsall.bat. This step is necessary for compatibility with precompiled qpdf binaries and proper Python extension building on Windows.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/source_build.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bat
CODE:
```
%VS140COMNTOOLS%\..\..\VC\vcvarsall.bat" x64
set DISTUTILS_USE_SDK=1
set MSSdk=1
```

TITLE: Declaring Sphinx Documentation Dependencies in requirements File - Plain Text
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists required dependencies for building documentation with Sphinx in a requirements-style plain text file. It includes Sphinx, several Sphinx extensions for auto API documentation, issue linking, and design integration, a Read the Docs theme, and tomli for Python versions below 3.11. The file is designed to be used by dependency managers like pip to install all necessary documentation-related packages, especially on platforms like Read the Docs that may not process metadata in pyproject.toml files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plain text
CODE:
```
# This is provided for the benefit of readthedocs.org, which cannot\n# yet read pyproject.toml to obtain what\n# pip install pikepdf[docs] would install.\n\nSphinx >= 3\nsphinx-autoapi >= 3\nsphinx-issues\nsphinx-design\nsphinx-rtd-theme\ntomli; python_version < '3.11'
```

TITLE: Compiling a Debug Build of QPDF with CMake
DESCRIPTION: Commands to build QPDF from source with debugging symbols enabled using CMake. The ENABLE_QTC option enables additional debugging features, and CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug ensures debug symbols are included.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/references/debugging.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash

```
# in qpdf source tree

cmake -S . -B build -DENABLE_QTC=ON -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug
```

TITLE: Defining sphlib 3.0 License Terms
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet outlines the license terms for the sha2 code from sphlib 3.0, which is used in the project. It grants permission to use, modify, and distribute the software under certain conditions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/licenses-for-wheels.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Copyright (c) 2007-2011  Projet RNRT SAPHIR

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining
a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the
"Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including
without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish,
distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to
permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to
the following conditions:

The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included
in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND,
EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF
MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.
IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY
CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT,
TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE
SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.
```

TITLE: MPL Source Code License Notice Template
DESCRIPTION: Standard notice text to be included in source code files to indicate they are licensed under MPL 2.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/licenses-for-wheels.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public\nLicense, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this\nfile, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
```

TITLE: Incompatible With Secondary Licenses Notice
DESCRIPTION: Notice text for marking source code as incompatible with secondary licenses under MPL 2.0
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/LICENSES/MPL-2.0.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
This Source Code Form is "Incompatible With Secondary Licenses", as\ndefined by the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0.
```

TITLE: RST Figure Directive
DESCRIPTION: RST figure directive configuration for displaying a pike fish release image with alignment and width settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/docs/releasenotes/index.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. figure:: /images/pike-release.jpg
    :figwidth: 30%
    :alt: pike fish being released to water
    :align: right

    Releasing a pike.
```

TITLE: GNU FDL Copyright Notice Template

SOURCE: https://github.com/pikepdf/pikepdf/blob/main/LICENSES/GFDL-1.2-or-later.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

CODE:

A copy of the license is included in the section entitled "GNU Free Documentation License".
